translated: “Just as this king, with a mind attached to afflictions, has repeatedly asked me and cut off my major and minor body parts,

analyzed: thams cad sbyin pa /

original: thams cad yongs su gtong ba /
analyzed: thams cad yongs su gtong ba /

analyzed: chags pa med par yongs su gtong ba /

analyzed: gtong ba chen po la gnas pa ste /

analyzed: de lhag par byams pa la shin tu goms pas /

analyzed: de nyin gcig la lan gsum byams pa la snyoms par 'jug par byed de /

analyzed: slong ba po'i skye bo phongs par gyur nas des blon po rnams la bsgo ba / shes ldan dag grong @176a *//

analyzed: khyer w'a ra n'a si'i grong khyer gyi sgo bzhi rnams su sbyin gtong gi khang pa brtsig tu bcug la dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / bkren pa dang / phongs pa dang / lam du 'jug pa'i slong mo ba gang dag ci don du gnyer ba de dag byin cig /
translated: “Sirs, build houses for giving alms at the four city gates of the city of Vārāṇasī and give to the ascetics, brahmins, the poor, the destitute, and the beggars who enter the road whatever they need.”

analyzed: lha bka' bzhin 'tshal /

analyzed: zas dang / skom dang / gos dang / gnas mal dang / dbyig dang / gser dang / nor bu dang / mu tig dang / bee d'urya dang / man shel dang / byi ru dang / sa le sbram dang / dngul dang / rdo'i snying po dang /
translated: gold, silver, jewels, pearls, beryl, conch shells, crystals, corals, refined gold,🔽silver, cat’s eyes,🔽moonstones, rubies, and clockwise-coiled shells, and so on.

analyzed: spug dang / padma r'a ga dang / g-yas su 'khyil ba la sogs te; nor mang pos slong mo ba'i skye bo tshim par bya ba'i phyir phung por spungs so //

analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na rgyal po rnam thos kyi bus /

analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang lcang lo can nas mdangs 'phrog pa'i gnod sbyin lnga spyugs te /

original: phan tshun 'phyan pa las w'a ra n'a sir phyin nas /
analyzed: phan tshun 'phyan pa las w'a ra n'a sir phyin nas /

analyzed: de rnams kyis ba lang gi rdzi dang / lug rdzi dang / rtsva thun dang / shing thun dang / lam gyis 'tsho ba dang; lam gol bas 'tsho ba'i mi rnams mthong nas smras pa /
translated: They saw the cowherds, the shepherds, the grass-cutters, the wood-cutters, the road-sweepers, and the people who lived by the road.

analyzed: shes ldan dag khyed cag kho bo cag gis mi 'jigs sam /

analyzed: shes ldan dag gang gi phyir kho bo cag gi rgyal po byams pa dang snying rje'i bdag nyid can sems can la phan pa'i bsam pas /
translated: “Sirs, since our king is loving and compassionate, and has the intention to benefit sentient beings,

analyzed: nyin gcig la lan gsum du byams pa la snyoms par 'jug pa yod na ci'i phyir 'jigs /

analyzed: de nas de rnams bram @176b ze'i cha byad du mngon par sprul nas /

analyzed: grong khyer w'a ra n'a si'i sgo bzhi rnams su sbyin gtong gi khang pa rnams la brtags te /
translated: and they examined the houses of charity at the four gates of the city of Vārāṇasī.

analyzed: rgyal po rdo rje'i dpung pa byams pa las langs par shes nas dul ba'i cha byad kyis rgyal po'i drung du song ngo //
translated: When they knew that King Vajra-bāhu had arisen from his meditation on loving-kindness, they went to the king in the appearance of the disciplined.

analyzed: song nas rgyal ba dang tshe spel ba dag rgyal po la byas nas smras pa /
translated: When they arrived, they wished victory and long life to the king and said,

analyzed: lha bdag cag bkres lags na g-yar zas kyis rjes su gzung du gsol /

original: rgyal pos blon po rnams bkug ste smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos blon po rnams bkug ste smras pa /

translated: “Sirs, satisfy these brahmins with good food.”

analyzed: de rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: rgyal pos blon po rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos blon po rnams la smras pa /

analyzed: shes ldan dag gal te sha dang / khrag gi 'byor pa med na /
translated: “Sirs, if you do not have the means to provide flesh and blood,

analyzed: tshong dus nas chos bzhin gyis rnyed pa'i khrag byin cig /
translated: then give them blood that you have acquired in accordance with the Dharma from the marketplace.”

original: de rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: They said,

analyzed: lha bdag cag ni mod la bkum pa'i sha dang khrag 'tshal na /

analyzed: mod la bkum pa'i sha dang khrag gis rjes su gzung bar mdzod cig /

original: rgyal pos bsams pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos bsams pa /
translated: The king thought,🔽🔽

analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa ma byas par mod la bsad pa'i sha dang / khrag ga la rnyed kyis ci nas kyang 'di rnams la bdag gis rang gi khrag sbyin par bya'o snyam ste /

analyzed: de nas dpyad mkhan rnams bkug ste smras pa /
translated: Then he summoned the physicians and said,

analyzed: shes ldan dag nga'i yan lag gi rtsa thams cad chod cig dang / slong mo ba'i skye bo tshim par bya'o //
translated: Sirs, cut the veins in all my limbs and satisfy the beggars.

original: dpyad mkhan rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dpyad mkhan rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The physicians said,

analyzed: lha mi phal pa rnams kyi phyir bdag cag lha'i sku la mtshon gyis mi 'debs so // byang chub sems dpa' ni bzo'i @177a *//

analyzed: gnas dang las kyi gnas de dang de dag la mkhas pa yin pas /

analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi rgyal po rdo rje'i dpung pa zhes bya bar gyur pa ni nga nyid yin no //

analyzed: de na yang ngas 'di rnams rang gi khrag gis tshim par byas nas brtul zhugs lnga'i gzhi rnams la bkod do //

translated: Now also I have satisfied them with the taste of the good Dharma, brought them out of the wilderness of cyclic existence, and established them in the highest, complete enlightenment of perfect buddhahood.”

analyzed: shin tu mthar thug pa'i grub pa dang bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa de'i tshe / dge slong rnams the tshom skyes te the tshom thams cad gcod pa /
translated: and established them in the unsurpassed, supreme welfare of nirvāṇa.🔽At that time, the monks were doubtful,

analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga sde'i dge slong rnams dam pa'i chos kyi ros tshim par mdzad nas /
translated: “Lord, please tell us why the Blessed One satisfied the five ascetic monks with the taste of the sublime Dharma,

analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa @177b nas bton te /
translated: led them out of the wilderness of saṃsāra,

analyzed: shin tu mthar thug pa'i grub pa dang bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa la gzigs /
translated: and established them in the unsurpassed, supreme welfare of nirvāṇa.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar nga 'dod chags dang bral; zhe sdang dang bral /

original: gti mug dang bral zhing zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gti mug dang bral zhing zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “I was free from delusion” up to

analyzed: ye shes dang shes bya thams cad la dbang brnyes nas / zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: “having attained mastery over all wisdom and knowledge,

analyzed: lnga sde'i dge slong rnams dam pa'i chos kyi ros tshim par mdzad nas /
translated: I satisfied the five ascetic companions with the taste of the sublime Dharma,

original: 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa nas bton te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa nas bton te /
translated: and having led them out of the wilderness of cyclic existence,

original: shin tu mthar thug pa'i grub pa dang / bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa de la ngo mtshar ci zhig che /
analyzed: shin tu mthar thug pa'i grub pa dang / bde ba'i mya ngan las 'das pa la bkod pa de la ngo mtshar ci zhig che /
translated: I established them in the ultimate accomplishment and the bliss of nirvāṇa.”

analyzed: ngas 'das pa'i dus na 'dod chags dang bcas zhes bya ba nas sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa rnams las yongs su ma grol ba na zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du ste /
translated: “In the past, I was not free from desire” up to “suffering, mental unease, and disturbance.”

analyzed: brtul zhugs lnga'i gzhi rnams la bkod pa gang yin pa de nyon cig /

analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba na grong khyer w'a ra n'a si na rgyal po byams pa'i stobs zhes bya ba 'byor pa dang / zhes bya ba nas skye bo dang / mi mang po yod pa na rgyal srid byed du 'jug ste / zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: He was a righteous king who ruled over the country,

original: byams pa'i bdag nyid snying rje can /
analyzed: byams pa'i bdag nyid snying rje can /
translated: who was kind, compassionate,

original: bdag nyid chen po sems can thams cad la byams pa dang ldan pa zhig yod do //
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po sems can thams cad la byams pa dang ldan pa zhig yod do //
translated: and who loved all beings.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na /
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na /
translated: Later,

analyzed: rgyal po rnam thos kyi bus rgyal po'i pho brang lcang lo can nas mdangs 'phrog pa'i gnod sbyin lnga nyes pa 'ga' zhig gi phyir spyugs nas /

analyzed: de @178a *// rnams ljongs de nas rgyu zhing /

analyzed: w'a ra n'a si'i skye bo'i tshogs shi bar gyur to //
translated: The people of Vārāṇasī died.

translated: “Deva, the people of Vārāṇasī have died.”

original: rgyal pos de rnams la bsgo ba /
analyzed: rgyal pos de rnams la bsgo ba /
translated: The king said to them,

original: deng la w'a ra n'a si kho nar dril sgrogs su chug la /
analyzed: deng la w'a ra n'a si kho nar dril sgrogs su chug la /
translated: “Go and have a proclamation made in Vārāṇasī itself:

original: shes ldan dag rgyal po byams pa'i stobs kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: shes ldan dag rgyal po byams pa'i stobs kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: ‘Sirs, King Maitrībala has said this:

analyzed: nga sems can thams cad la phan pa'i bsam pa la lhag par brtson pa'i yid kyis nyin mtshan 'da' bar byed kyi /

analyzed: de rnam sems can thams cad kyi rjes su song ba'i byams pa yid la zhugs pa na /
translated: When he had love that extended to all beings in mind,

original: mdangs 'phrog pa'i gnod sbyin rnams kyis w'a ra n'a si'i nye 'khor du rgyu bar brtsams na 'jug mi nus so //
analyzed: mdangs 'phrog pa'i gnod sbyin rnams kyis w'a ra n'a si'i nye 'khor du rgyu bar brtsams na 'jug mi nus so //

original: de rnams kyis 'jug ma nus pas glags ma rnyed do //

analyzed: smra ba'i mchog ni rdzogs sangs rgyas //

original: de nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis /
analyzed: de nas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gis /

analyzed: rgyal po kri kri la chos dang ldan pa'i @188b gtam gyis yang dag par ston par mdzad / yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad /

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod par mdzad /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod par mdzad /

original: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: rnam grangs du mar chos dang ldan pa'i gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: He taught him the Dharma using a variety of approaches.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug /
translated: He inspired them to take it up,

original: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
analyzed: yang dag par gzengs bstod /
translated: exhorted them to take it up,

original: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu dga' bar mdzad nas gdan las bzhengs te gshegs so //
translated: and delighted them. Then he rose from his seat and departed.

original: de nas rgyal po kri kris yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gshegs nas ring por ma lon par shes nas mi zhig la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po kri kris yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung gshegs nas ring por ma lon par shes nas mi zhig la smras pa /
translated: Then King Kṛkī, knowing that the totally and completely awakened Buddha Kāśyapa had not gone far, said to a man,

original: kye nang rje tshur shog /
analyzed: kye nang rje tshur shog /
translated: “Hey, come here!

original: khyod kyis 'bras sog ma'i sbubs su smin bas shing rta lnga brgya tsam khong la rdza mkhan dga' skyong gang na ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'bras sog ma'i sbubs su smin bas shing rta lnga brgya tsam khong la rdza mkhan dga' skyong gang na ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Fill five hundred carts with husked rice and go to the potter Nandīpāla.

original: rdza mkhan dga' skyong la 'di skad ces /
analyzed: rdza mkhan dga' skyong la 'di skad ces /
translated: When you get there, say to the potter Nandīpāla,

original: des pa dga' skyong khyod la rgyal po kri kris 'bras sog ma'i sbubs su smin pa shing rta lnga brgya tsam po bskur ba 'di dag yin gyi /
analyzed: des pa dga' skyong khyod la rgyal po kri kris 'bras sog ma'i sbubs su smin pa shing rta lnga brgya tsam po bskur ba 'di dag yin gyi /
translated: ‘Nandīpāla, these five hundred carts filled with husked rice are a gift from King Kṛkī to you.

original: de las khyod bdag nyid dang khyod nyid kyi pha ma yang dag pa'i bde bas tshim par bya ba dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung la yang dus dus su bsod snyoms phul cig ces gsung ngo zhes smros shig /
analyzed: de las khyod bdag nyid dang khyod nyid kyi pha ma yang dag pa'i bde bas tshim par bya ba dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung la yang dus dus su bsod snyoms phul cig ces gsung ngo zhes smros shig /
translated: Tell him, 'You should satisfy yourself and your parents with perfect happiness, and from time to time offer alms to the Perfectly Awakened Buddha Kāśyapa.'

original: lha bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes mi des rgyal po kri kris las mnyan nas 'bras sog ma'i su smin pas shing rta lnga brgya tsam bkang ste /
analyzed: lha bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes mi des rgyal po kri kris las mnyan nas 'bras sog ma'i su smin pas shing rta lnga brgya tsam bkang ste /
translated: The man said, Your Majesty, I will do as you command. He took the order from King Kṛkī, filled about five hundred carts with the rice that had ripened in the husk,🔽and went to the potter Nandīpāla.

original: rdza mkhan dga' skyong gang na ba der song nas phyin pa dang / rdza mkhan dga' skyong la 'di skad ces smras so //🔽des pa dga' skyong khyod la rgyal po kri kris 'bras sog ma'i sbubs su smin pas @189a *//
analyzed: rdza mkhan dga' skyong gang na ba der song nas phyin pa dang / rdza mkhan dga' skyong la 'di skad ces smras so // des pa dga' skyong khyod la rgyal po kri kris 'bras sog ma'i sbubs su smin pas @189a *//
translated: When he arrived, he said to the potter Nandīpāla, Nandīpāla, this is the rice that has ripened in the husk,

original: shing rta lnga brgya tsam po bskur ba 'di dag yin gyis /
analyzed: shing rta lnga brgya tsam po bskur ba 'di dag yin gyis /
translated: about five hundred carts of it, that King Kṛkī has sent to you.

original: de las khyod bdag nyid dang khyod kyi pha ma yang dag pa'i bde bas tshim par bya ba dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung la yang dus su bsod snyoms phul cig ces gsung ngo //
analyzed: de las khyod bdag nyid dang khyod kyi pha ma yang dag pa'i bde bas tshim par bya ba dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung la yang dus su bsod snyoms phul cig ces gsung ngo //
translated: “You should satisfy yourself and your parents with true happiness, and you should offer alms to the Perfectly Awakened Buddha Kāśyapa in a timely way.”

original: kye nang rje rgyal po rnams ni bya ba dang sgrub pa mang ngo zhes smras nas len tu ma btub bo //
analyzed: kye nang rje rgyal po rnams ni bya ba dang sgrub pa mang ngo zhes smras nas len tu ma btub bo //
translated: “O master, kings have many things to do and many things to take care of,” he said, and he did not accept it.

original: dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Monks, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi bram ze'i khye'u bla ma gang yin pa de ni nga nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi bram ze'i khye'u bla ma gang yin pa de ni nga nyid yin te /
translated: The one who was the young brahmin Uttara at that time, on that occasion, was indeed me.

original: ngas dge sbyong mgo reg de la byang chub ga la yod /
analyzed: ngas dge sbyong mgo reg de la byang chub ga la yod /
translated: I said to that shaven-headed ascetic, ‘How can you attain awakening?🔽Awakening is extremely difficult to attain,’ and I spoke harshly to the Perfectly Awakened Buddha Kāśyapa.

original: byang chub ni mchog tu dka' ba yin no zhes yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung la ngag rtsub po phyung ba gang yin pa de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas /
analyzed: byang chub ni mchog tu dka' ba yin no zhes yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'od srung la ngag rtsub po phyung ba gang yin pa de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas /
translated: As the result of that action,

original: da ltar ngas dka' ba lo drug spyad do //
analyzed: da ltar ngas dka' ba lo drug spyad do //
translated: I now practiced austerities for six years.”

original: gal te ngas byang chub la skur pa btab par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ngas byang chub la skur pa btab par gyur na /
translated: If I were to disparage awakening,

original: slar yang ngas byang chub kyi ched du bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bdag nyid dub par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang ngas byang chub kyi ched du bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du bdag nyid dub par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then again I would have to exhaust myself for three incalculable aeons for the sake of awakening.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na /
translated: Therefore, monks,

original: las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni gcig tu gnag pa yin pa zhes bya ba nas las gcig tu dkar ba rnams la brtsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni gcig tu gnag pa yin pa zhes bya ba nas las gcig tu dkar ba rnams la brtsal bar bya ste /
translated: you should strive for actions that are entirely bright, and so on up to

original: dge slong dag khyod kyis de lta bu la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyod kyis de lta bu la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin no //
translated: you should train in that way, monks.

original: gang gi nyi ma la byang chub sems dpa' phyir byung ba de nyid kyi nyi ma la /
analyzed: gang gi nyi ma la byang chub sems dpa' phyir byung ba de nyid kyi nyi ma la /
translated: On the very day that the Bodhisattva left home,

original: grags 'dzin ma sems can dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma sems can dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: Yaśodharā conceived a child.

original: gang gi tshe byang chub @189b sems dpa' dka' ba spyod pa'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub @189b sems dpa' dka' ba spyod pa'i tshe /
translated: When the Bodhisattva was practicing austerities,

original: btsun mo yang dka' ba spyod pa la zhugs pas /
analyzed: btsun mo yang dka' ba spyod pa la zhugs pas /
translated: the queen also engaged in austerities.

original: grags 'dzin ma mngal zhum par gyur to //
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma mngal zhum par gyur to //
translated: Yaśodharā’s womb became weak.

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis dka' ba spyad pa don med par thugs su chud nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyis dka' ba spyad pa don med par thugs su chud nas /
translated: When the Blessed One realized that his austerities were pointless,

analyzed: ci bder dbugs 'byin pa dang / ci bder dbugs rngub pa dang / 'bras chan dang / zan dron gyi zhal zas mang po gsol zhing /
translated: he began to breathe as he liked, eat as he liked, and consume plenty of food such as rice and barley.

original: mar dang til mar gyis sku byugs nas /
analyzed: mar dang til mar gyis sku byugs nas /
translated: He anointed his body with butter and sesame oil,

original: chu 'jam pos sku 'khru bar mdzad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: chu 'jam pos sku 'khru bar mdzad pa de'i tshe /
translated: and bathed his body with warm water.

original: btsun mo yang ci bder dbugs 'byin pa dang / ci bder dbugs rngub pa dang / 'bras chan dang / zan dron gyi kha zas mang po za zhing /
analyzed: btsun mo yang ci bder dbugs 'byin pa dang / ci bder dbugs rngub pa dang / 'bras chan dang / zan dron gyi kha zas mang po za zhing /
translated: At that time, the queen also breathed as she liked, ate as she liked, and consumed plenty of food such as rice and barley.

original: mar dang til mar gyis lus byugs nas; chu 'jam pos lus 'khru bar byed pa de'i tshe mngal de yang slar rgyas par gyur to //
analyzed: mar dang til mar gyis lus byugs nas; chu 'jam pos lus 'khru bar byed pa de'i tshe mngal de yang slar rgyas par gyur to //
translated: She anointed her body with butter and sesame oil, and bathed her body with warm water. At that time, her womb also began to grow again.

original: de'i mngal gyi mtshan ma skyes par gyur pa dang / sh'akya rnams kyis co dri ba dang bcas pas smras pa /
analyzed: de'i mngal gyi mtshan ma skyes par gyur pa dang / sh'akya rnams kyis co dri ba dang bcas pas smras pa /
translated: When the signs of her pregnancy appeared, the Śākyas said with contempt,🔽“

original: byang chub sems dpa' dka' thub kyi nags su bzhud nas khyod kyis byi phyin to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dka' thub kyi nags su bzhud nas khyod kyis byi phyin to //
translated: “The Bodhisattva has gone to the forest of asceticism. You have lost your mouse.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: She said,

original: kho mo'i sdig pa zhi bas byi ma phyin to //
analyzed: kho mo'i sdig pa zhi bas byi ma phyin to //
translated: “My sins have been pacified, so I haven’t lost my mouse.”🔽“How do you know?”

original: ci mngon / khyed cag yid ches par bya'o //
analyzed: ci mngon / khyed cag yid ches par bya'o //
translated: “You must believe me.”

original: ji tsam zhig na de khye'u zhig btsas te /
analyzed: ji tsam zhig na de khye'u zhig btsas te /
translated: Then she gave birth to a boy.

original: de nyi ma gang la btsas pa'i nyi ma de nyid la zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin to //
analyzed: de nyi ma gang la btsas pa'i nyi ma de nyid la zla ba sgra gcan gyis zin to //
translated: On the very day he was born, the moon was seized by Rāhu.

original: de btsas pa'i btsas ston byas nas /
analyzed: de btsas pa'i btsas ston byas nas /
translated: They celebrated his birth.

original: khye'u yi ming cir gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: khye'u yi ming cir gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed do //
translated: “What name should we give this boy?”

original: de'i nye du rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de'i nye du rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: His relatives said,

original: 'di btsas pa na zla ba sgra can gyi zin pas de bas na khye'u yi ming sgra gcan zin du gdags so zhes btags so //
analyzed: 'di btsas pa na zla ba sgra can gyi zin pas de bas na khye'u yi ming sgra gcan zin du gdags so zhes btags so //
translated: “Since the moon was seized by Rāhu on the day he was born, we shall name this boy Rāhula.”

original: gzhon nu btsas pa na sh'akya rnams la yang dang yang du gleng ba kho nar byed nas /
analyzed: gzhon nu btsas pa na sh'akya rnams la yang dang yang du gleng ba kho nar byed nas /
translated: When the prince was born, the Śākyas were constantly reminded of the prophecy.

original: des @190a *// bden pa gsol ba byas te /
analyzed: des @190a *// bden pa gsol ba byas te /
translated: He made a request for the truth:

analyzed: sgra gcan zin bzang po byang chub sems dpa'i pang tshad kyi rdo la zhon nas /
translated: Rāhula, the son of the Bodhisattva, rode on a stone the size of a man

original: rol pa'i rdzing gi nang du bcug ste /
analyzed: rol pa'i rdzing gi nang du bcug ste /
translated: and was put into the pleasure pool.

original: gal te 'di byang chub sems dpa' las skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di byang chub sems dpa' las skyes pa yin na /
translated: “If this is the son of the Bodhisattva,

analyzed: 'phyo bar gyur cig / ces bcug pa dang / de pha rol tu byung ngo //
translated: may he float.”🔽He was put in and he went to the other side.

original: des pha rol nas tshu rol tu 'ong bar gyur cig ces smras pa dang / de pha rol nas tshu rol tu 'ongs nas /
analyzed: des pha rol nas tshu rol tu 'ong bar gyur cig ces smras pa dang / de pha rol nas tshu rol tu 'ongs nas /
translated: “May he come from the other side to this side,” he said. He came from the other side to this side.

original: de rnams ngo mtshar skyes par gyur to //
analyzed: de rnams ngo mtshar skyes par gyur to //
translated: They were amazed.

original: grags 'dzin mas smras pa /
analyzed: grags 'dzin mas smras pa /
translated: Yaśodharā said,

original: shes ldan dag ji ltar 'di byang chub sems dpa' las skyes pa yin zhing kho mos byi ma phyin par yang yid chos par bya'o //
analyzed: shes ldan dag ji ltar 'di byang chub sems dpa' las skyes pa yin zhing kho mos byi ma phyin par yang yid chos par bya'o //
translated: “Sirs, how is this the son of the Bodhisattva? I will believe it if he goes out the door without my help.”

original: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi lo drug gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi lo drug gis mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: When the Blessed One had attained complete buddhahood after six years,

original: lo bcu gnyis 'das pa na /
analyzed: lo bcu gnyis 'das pa na /
translated: twelve years had passed.

original: ser skya'i gzhir byon nas /
analyzed: ser skya'i gzhir byon nas /
translated: He came to Kapilavastu.

original: nyi ma gcig ni rgyal po'i pho brang du gdugs tshod gsol /
analyzed: nyi ma gcig ni rgyal po'i pho brang du gdugs tshod gsol /
translated: One day he was invited to the king’s palace for the midday meal.

original: nyi ma gcig ni btsun mo'i nang du gsol ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: nyi ma gcig ni btsun mo'i nang du gsol ba de'i tshe /
translated: One day he was invited to the queen’s quarters for the midday meal.

original: grags 'dzin ma 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: At that time Yaśodharā thought,

original: gang gis na bcom ldan 'das bdag gi dbang du gyur pa'i thabs legs pa ci zhig yod snyam mo //
analyzed: gang gis na bcom ldan 'das bdag gi dbang du gyur pa'i thabs legs pa ci zhig yod snyam mo //
translated: “What is the best way for the Blessed One to come under my power?”

original: ser skya'i gzhi na kun tu rgyu mo dbang du bya ba la sogs pa'i las rnams la shin tu mkhas pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: ser skya'i gzhi na kun tu rgyu mo dbang du bya ba la sogs pa'i las rnams la shin tu mkhas pa zhig yod de /
translated: In Kapilavastu there was a wandering ascetic who was very skilled in the arts of subjugation and so forth.

original: grags 'dzin mas de la kar sha pa na lnga brgya byin nas /
analyzed: grags 'dzin mas de la kar sha pa na lnga brgya byin nas /
translated: Yaśodharā gave her five hundred kārṣāpaṇas

original: che zhe kar sha pa na 'di rnams las dbang du bya ba byos la skur cig /
analyzed: che zhe kar sha pa na 'di rnams las dbang du bya ba byos la skur cig /
translated: and said, “Sister, with these kārṣāpaṇas perform a subjugation ritual and send it to me.”

original: des dbang du bya ba'i la du zhig grags 'dzin ma la bskur ba dang / grags 'dzin mas sgra gcan zin gyi lag tu byin nas smras pa @190b bu khyod kyis yab gang yin pa de la phul cig /
analyzed: des dbang du bya ba'i la du zhig grags 'dzin ma la bskur ba dang / grags 'dzin mas sgra gcan zin gyi lag tu byin nas smras pa @190b bu khyod kyis yab gang yin pa de la phul cig /
translated: The ritual was performed and the subjugation substances were sent to Yaśodharā, who gave them to Rāhula. She said, “Son, give this to your father.”

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis de lta bu mi mkhyen pa dang / mi gzigs pa dang / thugs su mi chud pa dang / rnam par mi rig pa ci yang mi mnga' bas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis de lta bu mi mkhyen pa dang / mi gzigs pa dang / thugs su mi chud pa dang / rnam par mi rig pa ci yang mi mnga' bas /
translated: There is nothing that the Blessed Buddhas do not know, do not see, do not understand, and do not notice.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: The Blessed One thought,

original: grags 'dzin ma la mi snyan pa grags kyis de spang bar bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma la mi snyan pa grags kyis de spang bar bya'o snyam nas /
translated: Yaśodharā's bad reputation has spread. I will remove it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas lnga brgya sprul pa dang / sgra gcan zin gyis sangs rgyas thams cad la brtags nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas lnga brgya sprul pa dang / sgra gcan zin gyis sangs rgyas thams cad la brtags nas /
translated: The Blessed One emanated five hundred Buddhas, and Rāhula examined all the Buddhas

original: bcom ldan 'das rgan pa'i dang bzhugs pa la phul lo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgan pa'i dang bzhugs pa la phul lo //
translated: and offered it to the Blessed One, who was sitting at the head of the row.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhes nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bzhes nas /
translated: The Blessed One accepted it

original: slar yang de la byin te sgra gcan zin gyis zos so //
analyzed: slar yang de la byin te sgra gcan zin gyis zos so //
translated: and gave it back to Rāhula, who ate it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis yon bsngo bar mdzad nas gshegs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes bzhin gzhon nu sgra gcan zin bzang po 'brang nas slar bzlog kyang ngus te slar ldog tu ma btub bo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis yon bsngo bar mdzad nas gshegs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi rjes bzhin gzhon nu sgra gcan zin bzang po 'brang nas slar bzlog kyang ngus te slar ldog tu ma btub bo //
translated: When the Blessed One had finished dedicating the merit and was leaving, the young Rāhula followed the Blessed One, crying. He was not allowed to turn back.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs pa /
translated: The Blessed One thought,

original: sems can 'di ni srid pa tha ma pa yin pas 'dis khyim gyi gnas pas gnas mi phod do snyam mo //
analyzed: sems can 'di ni srid pa tha ma pa yin pas 'dis khyim gyi gnas pas gnas mi phod do snyam mo //
translated: “This being is in his last existence. He will not be able to remain in the household life.”

original: sgra gcan zin gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal 'tshos pa dang / rgyal po zas gtsang btsun mo'i bud med dang sh'akya rnams dang bcas pa ngo mtshar skyes nas /
analyzed: sgra gcan zin gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal 'tshos pa dang / rgyal po zas gtsang btsun mo'i bud med dang sh'akya rnams dang bcas pa ngo mtshar skyes nas /
translated: When Rāhula bowed to the Blessed One, King Śuddhodana, together with the women of the queen’s quarters and the Śākyas, were amazed.

original: grags 'dzin ma la lhag par mngon par dga' bar gyur to //
analyzed: grags 'dzin ma la lhag par mngon par dga' bar gyur to //
translated: They became especially fond of Yaśodharā.

original: de nas grags 'dzin ma'i mi snyan pa thams cad kyi thams cad du med par gyur to //
analyzed: de nas grags 'dzin ma'i mi snyan pa thams cad kyi thams cad du med par gyur to //
translated: Then all the unpleasant things about Yaśodharā completely disappeared.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhon nu sgra gcan zin bzang po rab tu dbyung bar brtsams pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhon nu sgra gcan zin bzang po rab tu dbyung bar brtsams pa /
